instruction_text:
To troubleshoot printer problems:

1. Check basic connections:
   - Verify printer is powered on
   - Check USB cable connection (if wired)
   - Verify network connection (if network printer)
   - Check printer status lights/display

2. Check printer status:
   - Open Settings > Devices > Printers & scanners
   - Verify printer shows as 'Ready'
   - Check for error messages
   - Look at printer queue for stuck jobs

3. Clear print queue:
   - Open Printers & scanners
   - Click printer > Open queue
   - Cancel all pending print jobs
   - Restart Print Spooler service

4. Restart Print Spooler:
   - Services.msc
   - Find 'Print Spooler'
   - Right-click > Restart
   - Or: net stop spooler && net start spooler

5. Reinstall printer driver:
   - Remove printer from Printers & scanners
   - Delete printer driver if option available
   - Add printer again (Windows will detect)
   - Install latest driver from manufacturer

6. Update printer driver:
   - Device Manager > Printers
   - Right-click printer > Update driver
   - Download from manufacturer website if needed

7. Check printer settings:
   - Right-click printer > Printer properties
   - Test print from properties window
   - Check default printer setting
   - Verify correct paper size and type

8. Network printer troubleshooting:
   - Ping printer IP address
   - Check printer IP in network settings
   - Verify printer is on same network
   - Re-add printer with correct IP

9. Check printer hardware:
   - Open printer cover and check for paper jams
   - Check ink/toner levels
   - Verify paper is loaded correctly
   - Check for error codes on printer display

10. Run printer troubleshooter:
    - Settings > Update & Security > Troubleshoot
    - Select 'Printer' troubleshooter
    - Follow troubleshooting steps

11. Test print from different application:
    - Try printing from Notepad
    - Try printing test page
    - Check if issue is application-specific

12. Check Windows Firewall:
    - Windows Firewall settings
    - Allow printer sharing if needed
    - Check if firewall blocking printer

13. Reset printer:
    - Power cycle printer
    - Reset to factory defaults (if safe)
    - Reconfigure network settings if needed

14. Check for Windows updates:
    - Install pending Windows updates
    - Updates may include printer driver fixes

15. Contact printer manufacturer:
    - Check warranty status
    - Refer to manufacturer support
    - May need hardware repair
